title: Coronation Street's Katie McGlynn stuns on Inside Soap Awards red carpet ahead of character's heartbreaking exit
text:

Coronation Street actress Katie McGlynn stunned at the Inside Soap Awards on Monday night – taking the red carpet by storm just hours after discussing how excited she is to be quitting the soap.

The 26-year-old actress has played Sinead Tinkeron the long running ITV show since 2013 and will bow out later this year after almost seven years on the Cobbles.

And the TV babe made sure she dazzled for what could be one of her final soap award ceremonies as she rocked up in an eye grabbing white dress.

With a plunging neckline and a cape-like detail flowing from her shoulders, Katie looked ready to party as prepared to cheer on co-stars Maureen Lipman, Sally Dynevor and Alison King who all scooped awards.

(Image: PA)

Katie wore scrappy heels and carried a YSL clutch as she attended the swanky bash at London’s Sway Bar in Covent Garden – while deep cherry red lipstick and nail polish made the TV babe’s make-up pop.

Katie’s appearance comes after she opened up about plans to quit the soap in OK! Magazine were published earlier in the day.

Fans of the ITV soap will watch as the character Sinead succumbs to cervical cancer and passes away – however Katie said she is grateful to have an important storyline to go out on as it could impact lives across the country.

(Image: PA)

(Image: Mike Marsland/WireImage)

"I said we should finish with the saddest ending because life’s not a fairy tale,” she said.

"I’ve been affected by people in my family who had cancer and I wanted to showcase that. I think a soap should reflect real life, I’m saddened that I’m leaving, but I want to create awareness,” she added.

The star recently revealed to This Morning that she'd sobbed on set throughout her last episode.

(Image: ITV)

"It's heartbreaking, but it's real life. When we were doing scenes that day, I thought that I can't imagine this happening to me," she said.

The actress previously spoke about the positive impact the story has had.

She proudly revealed nurses have contacted her to tell her that the number of women going for smear tests has soared since the tragic plot unfolded.

Katie said: "It’s messages like this that make it all worthwhile. Feel privileged to be a part of this storyline."
description: The soap actress will bow out of the ITV soap later this year following six years of life on the cobbles
